item.title: Issue #2258 created
item.description:
array:split() isn't exactly the inverse of array:join()?

The note on array:split() states:

This function is the inverse of array:join.

But I think this isn't quite correct. As the input to array:join() is a sequence of (possibly empty, or size one or more) arrays, I believe deep-equal($A, array:join($A) => array:split()) should only be true when $A is itself a sequence of single-entry arrays.

Or am I missing something? The issue #826 doesn't seem to cover this.
